alert.note: Alert for Clark; Floyd; Harrison; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 1:25AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Gusty winds out ahead of a line of thunderstorms will impact portions of Clark, Floyd, southeastern Washington, Harrison, Oldham, western Nelson, Meade, southwestern Larue, western Hart, Grayson, Jefferson, Hardin, Bullitt, Edmonson, northeastern Butler, northern Warren, eastern Breckinridge and northwestern Barren Counties through 200 AM EDT/100 AM CDT/... At 125 AM EDT/1225 AM CDT/, Gusty winds out ahead of a line of thunderstorms will a line extending from 10 miles south of Salem to near Morgantown. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Albany, Bowling Green, Louisville, Jeffersonville, Prospect, Rolling Fields, Glenview, Riverwood and Mockingbird Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
